timeline.message:
Add the SolrServiceWorkspaceWorkflowRestrictionPlugin and the workflowAdmin bean

This moves some workspace and workflow specific code from SolrServiceImpl to
the new SolrServiceWorkspaceWorkflowRestrictionPlugin. This also updates the
SolrServiceResourceRestrictionPlugin to restrict those records based on read
rights as well.
Add comments to discovery.xml config and move constants to plugin class
Add an integration test for the workflowAdmin configuration
Add license to new java file
Make a separate bean for workflowAdmin and clarify the comments in the ITs

timeline.bodyText: would not be better to index the wrofklowitem directly and just limit this configuration to retrieve the workflowitem instead than tasks? the UI need to list the workflowitem and delete / reset such workflow. A single workflow could result in multiple tasks depending on the workflow steps so there is not necessary a one to one mapping. Having the count in the UI based on tasks instead than workflow could generate confusion in the admin

replies.author: benbosman

replies.bodyText:
@benbosman and @abollini : At a quick glance, I admit I was also a bit confused by this configuration.  If a WorkflowItem can have multiple Tasks, then is it possible that the WorkflowItem would appear multiple times (under multiple tasks) in this index? Would that cause issues in the UI layer?
All that said, I anticipate this should be similar to the existing workflowConfiguration in discovery.xml....and that configuration also uses PoolTask OR ClaimedTask.  So, on a second glance, it seems like that is how we've already been indexing WorkflowItems...so, it appears this configuration likely is correct as-is.
See https://github.com/DSpace/DSpace/blob/master/dspace/config/spring/api/discovery.xml#L775
This might be simply an opportunity to add a more descriptive inline comment before these defaultFilterQueries for WorkflowItem based indexes.  It's not immediately clear to me why we are indexing the Tasks themselves, but there must be a reason for it (I'd need to dig in further to better understand why myself)
replies.author: tdonohue

timeline.bodyText: Not necessarily required of this PR, but this big if/else if seems like something we should refactor at some point.  It implies to me that IndexableInProgressSubmission, IndexablePoolTask and IndexableClaimedTask should all implement an interface that has a getDSO() (or getRelatedDSO()) method.   That would make this easier to extend in the future.
timeline.author: tdonohue

replies.bodyText:
I agree
We didn't want to change the discovery indexable objects in this PR, but it would definitely improve the functionality here, and can perhaps be used in the future in other locations where the item of any workflow object should be retrieved
